title: Patient Access Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Mercy
Interview Descriptions: As I recall, there was a relatively short phone interview, and then an in-person interview with the center director, which was rather formal in nature, along with a typing test.
Interview Questions: The interview questions were of the "Tell me about a time when you....." sort of questions. Right along the STAR format.

title: Licensed Practical Nurse (LPN) Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Mercy (Joplin, MO)
Interview Descriptions: Took weeks to hear back on application before interview was scheduled. On arrival was not even interviewed for position applied for, was told that spot was filled but that they figured I would be fine to interview for a different position. Process was very disorganized and when I asked questions they dodged or gave very vague answers.
Interview Questions: Why I wanted to work there

title: Social Worker Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Mercy (Oklahoma City, OK)
Interview Descriptions: I had a self paced phone interview and was disconnected several times bc I have a T-Mobile phone. It was incredibly frustrating. You had 24 hours to do the interview and I didn’t have time to locate a different phone.
Interview Questions: Are you comfortable with prayer before meetings?

title: Human Resources Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Mercy (Chesterfield, MO) in May 2023
Interview Descriptions: You have to take an assessment test, which takes a few hours, and to be told thanks for applying without an interview offer—a waste of time. Never will I apply to this organization.
Interview Questions: 100 Question assessment and no interview offered. For just taking the test should automatically give you an interview. The test is toooooooooo long. 3 plus hours.

title: Therapist Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Mercy (Chicago, IL)
Interview Descriptions: Phone screen, panel interview, video and video questions used to understand how you handle conflict resolved situations on a team of with clients. Second interview with director level staff. Shadow in program with team and clients.
Interview Questions: How would you handle…….? What would you do in this situation?

title: Patient Access Representative Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Mercy (Saint Louis, MO)
Interview Descriptions: Once you fill out the application and upload your resume you must complete a Talent assessment before you will receive an interview. The assessment may take 45 minutes to an hour. Make sure you have time to complete it.
Interview Questions: What does teamwork mean to you?

title: CT Technologist Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Mercy (Rogers, AR) in Apr 2023
Interview Descriptions: Long but worth it. They are very good about sticking to their values. I made sure to study their values and core traits. I felt like it was laid back and easy.
Interview Questions: What makes you a great fit?

title: Counselor Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Mercy
Interview Descriptions: Face to face interview asking me why I would like to work for Mercy. Also asked about the company values and how I fit with those values. Relaxed and straightforward interview.
Interview Questions: One of the challenging clients I have worked with.

title: Pharmacy Technician Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Mercy
Interview Descriptions: beginning took a lot of paperwork. the application obviously required pharm tech certification. they ask general interview questions that judge how you face conflict and your problem-solving. they are also judging your customer service traits as well
Interview Questions: N/A

title: VP-Finance Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Mercy
Interview Descriptions: The hiring manager was very friendly, and the peer leaders were welcoming and full of great information during the interview. HR was friendly and helpful as well through the process. Communication was appropriate both during interviews and before and after.
Interview Questions: Tell me about your experience and how it applies to this role. Share a time you worked with leaders through a time of change.

title: Operations Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Mercy (Saint Louis, MO) in Mar 2023
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was very smooth and the staff/nurses were so friendly and encouraging! I felt very welcomed and at ease the entire time! The person I interviewed with was also amazing! She made the interview feel more like a conversation and less like an interrogation!
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work here?

title: Registered Nurse, BSN Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Mercy in Mar 2023
Interview Descriptions: Interview process was pleasant and with personable managers. Managers were open and realistic about unit staffing and expectations, took me on a tour and also encouraged growth during interview. Recruiter kept me up to date and reached out in an appropriate time frame with offer.
Interview Questions: Discuss a mistake you made Discuss a time when you had to change your plan quickly and adapt

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Mercy
Interview Descriptions: Simple interview. The biggest issue is getting an interview in the first place. They use a system that evaluates applicants when they apply. If you don’t pass, you don’t get an interview.
Interview Questions: They wanted to know about my relevant work experience.

title: Hospitalist Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at Mercy in Feb 2023
Interview Descriptions: Easy and quick interview. Very nice went over the job and toured the building. Seems like a nice place to work. Answered all my questions and gave me all the information I needed about the job
Interview Questions: How do you handle a busy schedule

title: CMA (AAMA) Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Mercy
Interview Descriptions: 1st you get a phone interview from a recruiter and then if they like your response they will push your application forward for jobs it’s up to the job to review your application and if they think you will be a good fit they will set up an interview
Interview Questions: What do you think you would bring to the team

title: Director Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Mercy
Interview Descriptions: Sequence is 30 min. interviews with behavioral based questions. Panel interview with several team members at the level above the positon and managers that would report to me. Interview didn’t leave much time to ask questions.
Interview Questions: Why I was considering mercy.

title: Chaplain Resident Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Mercy (Saint Louis, MO) in Jan 2023
Interview Descriptions: You will have to complete a very detailed and reflective application AND a video interview. The application includes a complete biograph, a spiritual biography, and questions about how you respond a spiritual care giver. They provided a list of interview questions ahead of time.
Interview Questions: They will ask about your experience, spiritual life and emotions.

title: Physical Therapist Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Mercy (Little Rock, AR) in Jan 2023
Interview Descriptions: My interview seemed backward. I applied on Monday and got a call on Thursday for an in-person interview the following Tuesday with the hiring manager. After that interview, I got an email for a self-paced phone interview. I got the job offer the following day.
Interview Questions: Tell me about a time where you worked for an organization where they did or did not have high standards how did you adapt?

title: Respiratory Equipment Tech Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Mercy
Interview Descriptions: Very professional, but yet still easy going. I appreciate the willingness to work with my school schedule. Very supportive of school. There was significant talk of my future even at the interview stage.
Interview Questions: Tell me a little about yourself?

title: Registered Nurse, BSN Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Mercy
Interview Descriptions: Very easy to interview and the questions were fairly standard. Department head-lead interview via Zoom call and each department head asked questions. Mercy prides themselves on their ministry so it would be helpful to know about their mission.
Interview Questions: If you were a fruit, which one would you be and why?

title: HR Manager Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Mercy
Interview Descriptions: The interview process is long and tedious. Especially, with all the openings they have available in Human Resources. The TA department appears to be short staffed with a lot of inexperienced employees.
Interview Questions: Would I come down on my salary requirements.

title: Project Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Mercy (Chicago, IL) in Oct 2022
Interview Descriptions: Panel interview. Pre-selected questions. Skills and problem solving foundation to interview questions for fitness and skilled professionals. I also gave sone examples of daily situations that can impact individuals in the morning, afternoon or night.
Interview Questions: What is the most difficult part of the day for a youth with mental health issues and why?

title: Urgent Care Nurse Practitioner Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Mercy (Springfield, MO) in Sept 2022
Interview Descriptions: 3 diffrent interviews, 2nd one was the most challenging. 1st interview was with gohealth and was badic screening/ information gathering. 3rd one was with HT about the organizational mission and values.
Interview Questions: What is a weakness that a patient has recognized in you

title: Certified Nursing Assistant CNA Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Mercy in Sept 2022
Interview Descriptions: First interview is with recruiter, then lead of hospital department you applied for. Pretty basic interview questions. Weakness, strength and tell me about a time… etc. for me it took a few days to get and offer but I didn’t start till maybe a month later.
Interview Questions: Tell me about a time you had and angry patient and what you did.

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Mercy
Interview Descriptions: Questions that represent your character and giving examples of how you responded in difficult situations.  Interview was with one manager. It was a professional atmosphere but was able to feel comfortable with the interviewer.
Interview Questions: Questions that represent your character and giving examples of how you responded in difficult situations.  Example: Tell me about a time when you made an error. How did you fix the error and what did the experience teach you.

title: Human Resources Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Mercy
Interview Descriptions: Interview process was standard with behavioral questions tied to company values where you had to describe a time you completed a task, project, or job while exemplifying one of their values.
Interview Questions: Tell me about a time you had to provide excellent service

title: Patient Service Agent Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Mercy (Joplin, MO) in Aug 2022
Interview Descriptions: It went amazing! They were very understand and helpful. Everyone there was also so so polite. They were so kind and fun. I loved every second of it!! I would definitely recommend working here.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work for us?

title: Patient Transporter Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Mercy
Interview Descriptions: It was straight to the point and the interviewing supervisor gave proper incite about what would be expected of the worker each day. Answered every question I had to the best of their knowledge.
Interview Questions: The last time you had to handle a disgruntled individual

title: Director Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 weeks. I interviewed at Mercy (Saint Louis, MO) in Jul 2022
Interview Descriptions: Thorough and thoughtful interview process that was clearly communicated from end-to-end and follow up was personable and insightful.  Mercy highly values ensuring the candidate is the right person for the job and culture.
Interview Questions: The questions were both behavioral as well as related to skills, abilities and experience.

title: Cook Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Mercy
Interview Descriptions: first part of my journey in the kitchen, mass hiring.   I was put in a room with so many people, I lost count.  The only thing they said is if you smoke, we can't hire you.
Interview Questions: can you cook and do you smoke.

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Mercy (Saint Louis, MO) in May 2022
Interview Descriptions: Smooth, pleasant, as expected.  They asked the typical nursing interview questions.  Name three strengths and two weaknessesThe supervisor discussed scheduling with meand said someone should be contacting me within a couple days.
Interview Questions: What can you bring to Mercy and this unit?

title: Senior Financial Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Mercy in May 2022
Interview Descriptions: I applied online. Got asked to fill out a personality test automatically (and passed). After that, recruiter reached out to do a recorded phone screen interview (1 day after quiz). The phone screening was somewhat weird. Already had questions lined up and you have under 1 minute to answer and it moves on. They asked about 6-7 pre-recorded questions (mainly situational-based). After I submitted, got asked to do a Teams interview with 2 managers (1 week after phone screen). Interview was pretty straight forward. The questions I was asked were mainly situational based. The managers told me to wait 2 weeks for an answer. They also told me I would be a great fit and they'll let me know the details later. However, 2 weeks on the dot passed and I got an email from the recruiter that the role was already filled.
Interview Questions: Tell me about a time where there was XYZ situation and how did you handle it.

title: Nurse Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Mercy
Interview Descriptions: Applied online. Recruiter reached out to set up interview. Interviewed with the unit manager and offered the job after answering a few general questions about my experience and personality and adaptability.
Interview Questions: Give examples of a time when you didn’t handle a situation the way you should have.

title: Registered Nurse, BSN Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Mercy
Interview Descriptions:
Very Easy - applied, interview, offer from HR, background check, and drug screen, and employee health

3 weeks start to finish from my application to the start of my first day at the hospital
Interview Questions: Previous work experience and strengths and weaknessess

title: Therapy Tech Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 days. I interviewed at Mercy in Apr 2022
Interview Descriptions: I applied online. The next day I got a call and talked on the phone about the job. Then went in for an interview a few days later. They showed me around the department and then asked me interview questions then let me talk with other members of the team
Interview Questions: What was a time you felt you failed and what did you learn?

title: Medical Practice Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Mercy
Interview Descriptions:
3 different interviews with 3 different managers 
It was before COVID so it was on-site. I had to drive to 3 different locations and meet with three different interviewees. Each interview was three hours long
Interview Questions: It was behavioral-based questions and went over my experience.

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Mercy
Interview Descriptions: Thorough, Recruitment to HR- Interviewed with direct supervisor, clinical supervisor was  also introduced to floor staff the same day.  Multiple handouts to explain exactly what to expect about the basics IE: clocking in, where to meet and accept assignments etc.
Interview Questions: How to react: code situation

title: Technician Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Mercy
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was very smooth and straightforward. There was an initial HR phone call followed up with an interview. Then there was an interview with the hiring manager. It was all very relaxed.
Interview Questions:
Tell me about yourself
How do you align with merry values

title: Patient Service Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Mercy (Rolla, MO) in Mar 2022
Interview Descriptions: Interview went very well, was led to believe I would be called in seven days or less, never received any calls or emails. Even reached out to person who interviewed me. My app had been duplicated and I wondered why, so I reached out. Still nothing. I had originally been asked for and interview and I responded yes, it then took two weeks to get a email back.
Interview Questions: If I had medical experience

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Mercy (Springfield, MO) in Feb 2022
Interview Descriptions: I applied and the interview consisted of a self-paced text interview, followed by a self-paced phone interview. After that it took about 3 days for them to contact me about an in-person interview.
Interview Questions: Tell me about a time when you had to do the best with limited resources

title: Nuclear Medicine Technologist Interview
Application Type: The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Mercy (Round Rock, TX) in Feb 2022
Interview Descriptions: Very good! I was very satisfied with their interview process. It was not too long and to the point. This was a great experience to see what all is out there as far as jobs go.
Interview Questions: What are your Very good! I was very satisfied with their interview process. It was not too long and to the point. This was a great experience to see what all is out there as far as jobs go.?

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Mercy
Interview Descriptions: Very warm, nice interviewer. Not intimidating and just wanted to get to know you to see if you’re a good fit for the floor. Recruiter was great and such a pleasure to work with. Overall very positive experience.
Interview Questions: Staff who don’t listen to your request, how would you respond

title: Patient Care Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Mercy
Interview Descriptions: Had an in-person interview. They did not ask me about my skills, background, or experience. They spent 30 minutes talking to me about Christianity and then proceeded to ask me a bunch of religious question. They even asked if I ever have had a spiritual conflict of interest. What the actual hell?? I'm now scared to even be a patient here since their main priority is religious affiliation instead of skills and quality care.
Interview Questions: Have you ever had a spiritual conflict of interest??

title: Graduate Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Mercy (Saint Louis, MO) in Dec 2021
Interview Descriptions: Applied online for ICU, call from recruiter, she acts like it's an interview for the ICU. It wasn't sets me up an interview & shadow for a step-down unit. Directions from Recruiter were not accurate on how to get to the unit I was shadowing on. Was placed on wrong unit. Manager forgot about me, then tried to push the actual interview to a different day/time. Recruiter called a few weeks later with an offer.
Interview Questions: How was your shadow experience?

title: Paramedic Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Mercy (Saint Louis, MO) in Dec 2021
Interview Descriptions: Interview with a manager. then shadowing a nurse in the ER.  Seeing the process the nurses and staff and medics use to help the many and various patients that come in.  Then following up with the manager in case I had any questions.
Interview Questions: Do you have any questions?

title: Pharmacy Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Mercy in Dec 2021
Interview Descriptions: Phone interview . Basic questions and answers . It. Was very positive but, I haven’t heard anything back in over a month.  I did interview for 2 positions at the same time. I also had been referred by people working at Mercy currently.
Interview Questions: How did I handle a difficult situation?

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Mercy (Ardmore, OK) in Dec 2021
Interview Descriptions: Applied for 13 week contract RN. Ad stated new nurse and experienced nurses. Lower pay than contract through a recruiter but was excited for the opportunity to work locally and be home every day. Have been a travel nurse but not in a hospital. I didn't see this as a potential problem since the ad said new nurse or experienced nurse.  Interview lasted 15min. Answered questions from a script. Was asked how I felt about being on the floor with minimal training, which I felt fine being that I have been doing that with my current travel RN work. Was called the next week and was told I was not chosen because I did not have recent experience with EPIC. I did EPIC in nursing school and it was not that difficult to utilize when you learn new EMRs frequently without a problem.  I guess the “new nurse” they were looking for is a new grad who has recently has their hands on EPIC and the experienced nurse they were looking for must have been a nurse with experience on the floor and EPIC. Ad was too vague as to what they obviously wanted.   Hired the next week by a large hospital in OKC, so all worked out anyways. Just disappointing how the process went.
Interview Questions: What do you feel your strengths are?

title: Health Information Services Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Mercy in Oct 2021
Interview Descriptions: Someone from Mercy reached out to me to schedule an interview. An in-person interview was preferred by the interviewer, but I had one over the phone without any problem. I was notified of what the possible next steps in the application process would be which is something I was grateful for.
Interview Questions:
- Tell me about a time where you encountered a conflict and solved it.
- What is your five-year plan?
- What makes you a good fit for this job?

title: Business Office Associate Interview

Interview Questions: Why do you think you are a good candidate for Mercy?

title: Physician Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Mercy
Interview Descriptions: Zoom interview that took about 45min. It was a group interview with 5 people. Each person asked a question and at the end they told me they will give me a response within 2 weeks.

title: Patient Care Assistant (PCA) Interview

Interview Questions: N/A

They have you set up a "coworker health screen" which was basically a drug test, they take your blood pressure, gave me a flu shot, and then fit me for a n95 mask.

title: Certified Nursing Assistant Interview

title: Educational Assistant Interview

Interview Descriptions: Typical. List of 5-10 questions. Back and forth dialog. Tell me about a time when you went above and beyond, when it felt you could have improved. Do you have any questions?
Interview Questions: Where do you see Yourself in 5 years?

title: Preregistration Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied through a staffing agency. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Mercy (Oklahoma City, OK) in Jun 2021
Interview Descriptions: Met with all managers in a group and went over what they expect of us to do. Went over the mercy mission statement as well as a small tour. You should be interactive during this interview as personality is a big help, you will be on the phones often with patients and some will not be the happiest to hear from you due to medical reasons but you should be the calm positive tone on the phone.

title: Graduate Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Mercy (Saint Louis, MO)

Interview Descriptions: Submitted my application online and received a call from HR who discussed openings. Then, the manager of the unit I chose called me and described the unit and position and asked if I had any questions.

title: Physician Assistant Interview

Tell us about you...

5 year goals?

title: Housekeeping Interview

title: Registered Nurse Interview

Interview Descriptions: Standard nursing interview, easy and straight forward. Phone interview first followed by in person interview. Met with multiple people in department for interview to discuss role, all asked questions but easy to answer.
Interview Questions: Where do you see yourself in 5 years?

title: Sterile Processing Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Mercy (Saint Louis, MO) in Dec 2020
Interview Descriptions: It was great and reasonably questions . The question wasn’t to difficult.  Really just average questions.  First a phone interview then a in person interview or virtual due to COVID .
Interview Questions: How do you work in a stressful environment ?

title: Registered Nurse, BSN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Mercy in Dec 2020
Interview Descriptions: Applied online, did an over the phone pre-interview with headquarters before doing a panel interview in person. Only one manager arrived to the interview, thankfully the department I wanted. A little clumsy, but standard interview.
Interview Questions: How will you add value to the team?

title: Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Mercy
Interview Descriptions:
Smooth process on the HR side, with streamlined interview scheduling and good engagement from the recruiter. There was an initial online personality test screen -- I have fun doing those lol, but it was unclear what they were evaluating or what the results would be used for.

The HR phone screen asked 4 behavioral interview questions that aligned with Mercy's values -- pretty standard stuff. But the very first question they asked is whether I was comfortable with religion and prayer in the workplace. This felt a little awkward since I'm relatively agnostic but I guess I appreciate the heads up that religion is outwardly present in this organization.

Disappointing/frustrating interview experience with the hiring manager. I felt like he hadn't even reviewed my resume, as he asked me to describe very specific experience that I didn't even have. But there were no interview curveballs -- basically just "tell me about your experience with xyz." As we wrapped up the phone interview (which felt very rushed), I asked if I could pose a few more questions via email and he said that was fine and shared his contact info. But I received no response to my follow up email -- completely ghosted.

2 weeks later I checked in with the recruiter who did not have an update. 
2 weeks after that, I received an automated disconnect email from the applicant tracking system. Not even a personal note.
Interview Questions: What is your proudest accomplishment?

title: Therapist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Mercy
Interview Descriptions: It was very professional and they made me feel very comfortable! I was not qualified for the therapy position as I have only done individual therapy. They ask me to apply for other positions!
Interview Questions: About my experience with group therapy

title: Therapist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Mercy (Springfield, MO) in Oct 2020
Interview Descriptions: Lengthy process. Require personality test, HR interview, multiple phone conversations and finally the location interview.  None of the interviews were relevant to my skill set. I truly felt they wanted to get the least expensive employee regardless of experience or ability. If you have time to waste or want interview experience, this is a great option. If you want a career, you might want to continue looking.
Interview Questions: How would you contribute to the team?

title: Cardiovascular Technician II Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Mercy (Springfield, MO) in Oct 2020
Interview Descriptions: Be prepared for lots of odd questions, they are required to ask a specific set of questions per their ministry.  I also felt very awkward during their interview because my interviewer was not personal.
Interview Questions: How were you prepared in a situation with limited resources?

title: Ekg Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Mercy (Springfield, MA) in Sept 2020
Interview Descriptions: Over the phone  interview with manager . Must be at least twenty-five to thirty minutes for the whole interview process. Then you just wait to hear back from them, if you’re offered a position humans resources will contact you to let you know when your start day will be.
Interview Questions: Why should we hire you?

title: Nurse Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Mercy in Feb 2020
Interview Descriptions: Casual, yet professional. Consisted of a preliminary phone screen followed by several face to face interviews with various levels of leadership culminating with a peer interview. Interview process felt drawn out.
Interview Questions: how would I handle rejection or push-back from physicians

title: Organizational Effectiveness Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Mercy (Saint Louis, MO) in Jan 2020
Interview Descriptions: I applied online and received an email from a recruiter scheduling a phone assessment.  The recruiter was friendly and didn't ask too many questions.  She said that they already had internal candidates who would be a good fit for the position that I'd applied for but recommended me for another open position.   She asked what questions I had and described the next step in the process for me.  They base their decision entirely off of the second step in the process - a talent assessment, which she scheduled for me shortly after our conversation ended.  The talent assessment took place over the phone that evening. It lasted about 45 minutes or so and was completed by Talent+.  I didn't hear back after the assessment, but I assume had I "passed," an in-person interview would have been the next step.
Interview Questions: I can't give too much detail, but the talent assessment asked several variations of the same question to find out how competitive I was.  The assessor did not provide feedback to any of my responses and you could tell the intention was to pose the next question quickly so that I wouldn't have a lot of time to think about my response - it would just be what came to my head the fastest, implying that it was the most honest.  The assessor was professional and courteous, but it was difficult to hear her at multiple points during the assessment.  The questions were mired in gender and cultural bias (women, and particularly women are color, aren't "supposed" to come across as competitive) and were along the vein of - have you stopped beating your children; yes or no? - meaning there really wasn't a good or accurate response to many of the questions.  It went on for a while and close to the end, I really just wanted it to be over.  I've never experienced this feeling during an interview or job assessment before.  I was saddened that this is the new hiring process for the hospital.  As I said, I worked there previously and really enjoyed my time there and felt that the culture was excellent.  This introduction to the company was extremely off-putting and I feel it will exclude many women, people of color, and servant leaders, despite their actually being good fit for the position and company.  Had I not worked for Mercy before, I would have determined that it was not a good fit for me (or anyone, really), based on this interviewing experience.  It would have even been better if they'd done the assessment later in the process, perhaps with final candidates, but not where it's the first and only thing they go by.  My master's degree is in psychology and even I will admit that these sorts of assessments are not entirely accurate. So, to use it and only it as the basis for a major decision isn't a good idea.   Also, the name of the assessment if misleading.  They don't assess your talents - they assess what people feel their traits to be.  I wouldn't recommend this process to anyone.

title: RN, Bsn Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Mercy (Oklahoma City, OK) in Jan 2020
Interview Descriptions: I had a great eexperience during the interview process at Mercy Hospital. I have been thinking about starting a career here since I began nursing school and I am very thankful for this oppoertunity.
Interview Questions: Introduce self as if you were introducing yourself to a patient

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Mercy (Springfield, MO) in Dec 2019
Interview Descriptions: Phone interview was great, questions applied to position, they were kind and helpful. Onboarding was also very simple. Any questions that you had were quickly answered. Staff was great during that process as well.
Interview Questions: What is a positive about yourself?

title: Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Mercy (Oklahoma City, OK) in Nov 2019
Interview Descriptions: Applied, in-person interview, job offer. Each person was friendly to talk to and the in-person part went very smoothly and comfortably. I am happy with my decision to apply here to work.
Interview Questions: tell about your experience in healthcare

title: Nurse Tech Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Mercy (Oklahoma City, OK) in Aug 2019

title: CNA Interview

Interview Descriptions: Conduct a placement test to "match" with culture.  It is a "knock out" process.  You pass or your out.  Good tool if it was used as adjacent to hiring not a pass or fail process.

title: Patient Service Representative Interview

Answers are typed in to a computer and sent to HR after your interview. She told me I had the best resume she'd ever seen, and asked why I applied for such a "low position". I explained that I had been without a job for too long and just wanted an opportunity to get my foot in the door. It's been 2 months, I've left multiple messages with interviewer - to try and show I'm very interested - but on their website I'm still listed as "under review".
Interview Questions: Mercy is a faith-based organization, do you have a problem with praying at the beginning of every meeting?

title: CNA Interview

3. Face to face interview

title: Merchandiser Interview

Interview Descriptions: Interview with clinic manager and then a few clinic coworkers for good fit purposes.   Normal interview questions asked.   Reviewed my resume and spoke about how my experience relates to the position I applied for.

title: Patient Care Associate Interview

title: Pharmacy Technician Interview

Everything seem to go well until I went on a tour of the pharmacy and I asked why medications weren’t being transported on a locked medication cart. I guess I seemed guilty asking that question and being black. As if I would plan to steal something.
Interview Questions: What are your strengths ?

title: EHR Credentialed Instructor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Mercy in Jun 2018
Interview Descriptions:
I spoke with a recruiter first that asked me general questions about my previous experience. She then sent my information to the hiring manager. I did a phone interview with the hiring manager as I lived in a different state from her. We connected immediately, and it was more conversational than Q & A. 

A few days later, I then had to take a personality assessment. It took over an hour to do on the phone. I believe it was through a third party company. I had to answer questions about what I would do in certain scenarios and describe a time when I had done whatever the situation was. She wasn't allowed to give me any guidance or explain any of the questions further. Some questions were the same, just worded different. Not a fan of this part!

Since this was for a training position, I had to do a 15 minute presentation. The hiring manager chose my topic to be on how to do something. I had to put together a PPT. I went to the location I would be working at and presented to someone in the room along with people in other locations through screensharing and conference phone. *Be confident, have an introductory about you slide, remember people's names (write them down), ask the group or specific people questions throughout, practice timing your presentation beforehand.

I was then called by HR, and they gave me an offer. I counter offered for $1/hr more and got it. They base pay off your location more than your experience. The hiring manager doesn't really have a say in the offer.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Licensed Pharmacy Technician I Interview

Interview Descriptions: The overall interview process what slightly overwhelming at first, but once you see how friendly everyone is up front, it isn’t so bad. The process consisted of various open ended questions, your five year plan, and an overall understanding of why you wish to work for Mercy Hospital. My interview consisted of three tables and nine interviewers; three at each table. Everyone was well-rounded and knowledgeable in their line of business, so I felt comfortable the longer I was there. They were interested in what I was wanting to do with my future. I recommend reviewing the company’s core values and obtain an understanding for each value. Majority of the questions will be related to them. You will also be asked to provide a time in which you helped people or did something in a stressful time. Be sure to go in nicely dressed, open minded, and be precise on exactly what you want to get out of this opportunity. I am excited and I haven’t even started yet! Thank you, Mercy!
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Administrative Assistant III Interview

Interview Descriptions: A friend recommended I submit my resume for a position in the administration office. I had additional contact with the Mercy recruiter, but neither of these folks thought it necessary to provide follow up to me, which I felt to be unprofessional. Even a form-type letter or email to advise that they had gone a different direction would have been appreciated, and is so much better than ghosting a job candidate.
Interview Questions: Pretty much the standard questions throughout.

title: Analyst Interview

Interview Descriptions: The total process was 4 rounds: Initial HR phone screen, phone call with team manager, personality assessment and finally face to face interview (1/2 day meeting with several people at a time). Everyone at Mercy seems very nice and truly respects their co-workers and the overall mission of Mercy.
Interview Questions: Lots of specific questions about work I've done in my previous roles, what I've done to improve myself and how well I work with others.  Mercy definitely wants to hire people who fit in with their mission and values so be sure to mention you like what they stand for.

title: NICU Fellowship Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Mercy
Interview Descriptions: 4-6 weeks. Tedious process. Have to make sure to follow up. First I applied online. Nurse manager from NICU emailed me to set up a interview. Interview was with the nurse manager and the fellowship coordinator. Then set up a interview time with the HR. Still waiting to hear back from them.
Interview Questions: Name an accomplishment you achieved NOT related to your education/work experience. (basically a personal accomplishment)

title: Payroll Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Mercy
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was highly disappointing. I was highly disappointed in how the interview was conducted. Prior to the interview, I was called by the hiring manager to verify I was interested in the position because I was overqualified. I explained that I was interested in the position because I was changing industries and was new to health care. I said I would love the opportunity to interview.  My interview was horrible and the lack of skills exhibited made me not want to work for the company. My interviewers explained the position, said my resume was impressive, asked a few questions about my CPA plans.. and went "Do you have any questions?" The interview would have been over in 15 min flat, thankfully I had prepared typed out questions.  I hadn't said anything to leave a bad taste. I was on time, professionally dressed, brought a report with work experience. Yet, I was dismissed before the interview began. It was greatly apparent they had no interest interviewing me and it was a waste of BOTH our time. If your going to ask a candidate to come into an interview, make the effort to INTERVIEW the candidate. Lets compare this to my experience with interviews at Barns Jewish. I was provided a phone interview where I was highly screened, in-depth reference check, and a very professional and detailed interview that lasted over an hour. This type of professionalism is worth my time. I will hesitate to apply to Mercy again.
Interview Questions: What exam do you plan to take first for your CPA?

title: Recreational Therapist Interview

Interview Questions: What would a group therapy session look like under my care?

I was offered the job 20 minutes after the interview! Really easy experience.

title: Patient Service Representative Interview

title: Sleep Technologist Interview

title: Anesthesia Technician Interview

title: Supply Chain Interview

title: Medical Technologist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Mercy
Interview Descriptions: Online app followed by meeting with two directors then another day for hr to meet with me two weeks waiting for background check and employment verification then went back for drug screen and waited for results a week
Interview Questions: What could I bring to the table to help the company

title: Recreational Therapist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Mercy (Saint Louis, MO) in Aug 2017
Interview Descriptions: Applied, set up interview 2 days later, had a 10 minute cookie cutter interview with HR and then sent to a social worker who would be an immediate superior for a 30 minute interview. After the interview, I was asked if I'd be interested in coming in to observe for part of a day.
Interview Questions: HR asked, if you were eating lunch in the dining hall with coworkers and they were gossiping about a patient, what would you do?

title: Nursing Director Cardiac Cath Lab Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Mercy (Springfield, MO) in Aug 2017
Interview Descriptions:
Very shortly after I applied, less than 3 days,  I had a phone interview with HR. The next day I  had an hour phone screening with a 3rd party and within a week, I was called for an onsite interview. The whole first process took about 4 weeks from application to the end of the onsite interview. The HR person was great! She was newer to her role but was accommodating and provided a lot of good information. The 3rd party interview was a personality screening that took place over the phone but was very useful, in my opinion. The onsite interview took place with the Executive Director, a panel of managers (who would be my peers), and a physician panel. There was an extensive tour of the facilities and the ability to meet many of the staff of the hospital. Mercy paid for a car rental, a hotel room, and dinner. They also set up a community tour with a local realtor the next day. My husband and I were very excited about the possibility. After leaving the interview August 15th, the executive director told me I would hear by the end of the month. I understand this is a large organization and many hoops and lines to sign. 
Afterwards, I sent a Thank You to both the director and the HR director for the hospitality and their time. I received responses from both. However, I've since been ghosted. No letter, no email, no phone call. With all of the time and resources they used for these interviews, I'm unsure why there would be absolutely no follow up. If I'm not a good fit for the position, that should be communicated in some way.  I'm a hiring manager in my current position and I know things can come up that throw wrenches into the system but the lack of any communication is terribly unprofessional.
Interview Questions: How do you know when would be the time to delegate a responsibility?

title: Food Service Worker Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Mercy
Interview Descriptions: Got a call back about a week after applying. Met with manager and main supervisor. After regular interview questions I was shown around the department. Not soon after I got a call that said I got the job. I gave my 2 weeks to my previous job and started at Mercy right after.

title: Pharmacy Technician Interview

Interview Descriptions: Very brief, very casual, main interviewer seemed overwhelmed with other things and was distracted, however everyone was very friendly. Second interviewer was the on duty pharmacist. He was nice,  asked a few questions and returned to work.
Interview Questions: What is one thing y ou like about your current position?

title: Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 8 weeks. I interviewed at Mercy (Saint Louis, MO) in Apr 2017
Interview Descriptions: Took a long time to go through. Drug screen, back ground checks, personality test. The personality test is very serious to the process please take time while answering. If you do not pass personality test you will likely not be hired.

title: Telemedicine Navigator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Mercy (Chesterfield, MO) in Apr 2017
Interview Descriptions: Pretty extensive, although you don’t need a college degree for the role. Applied online, got a call from HR and then got another call assessing my morals/how I would act in certain situations
Interview Questions: Explain a time where you went above and beyond your role

title: Medical Secretary Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Mercy in Mar 2017
Interview Descriptions: I first interviewed with human resources and then I went for an interview the same day with my now supervisor. Both interviews were very pleasant and I left feeling confident.
Interview Questions: Mercy fit questions.

title: Sterile Processing Technician Interview

Interview Questions: Are you a Mercy Fit ?

title: Licensed Practical Nurse Interview

title: Lab Technician Interview

Interview Descriptions: She wasn’t even paying attention she just made sure I knew the steps on how to draw blood and she said I got the job she is lazy and cow
Interview Questions: Tell me how to draw blood

title: Social Work Interview

There was a nurse, care coordinator and 2 social workers, asking me questions about my desire to work in a hospital setting.

title: Nurse Extern Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Mercy (Fort Smith, AR)
Interview Descriptions: Great process! HR department was very encouraging and helpful. It felt very easy and conversational. The most important piece of advice I would give is to add community service to your resume. They found that a huge bonus, because they feel doing community service, tells a lot about you as a person. They feel that if you are willing to dedicate your time for free to others, then you'll be fantastic when they are paying you.
Interview Questions: Have you had any community service experience?

title: Operations Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Mercy in Feb 2017
Interview Descriptions: Why do you choose us, why we hire you. whats your last position. How do you like the job and daily basis. whats your working environment and blah blah bla lots of things
Interview Questions: Why do you choose us

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Mercy (Saint Louis, MO) in Jan 2017
Interview Descriptions: Was not difficult. Had my interview with HR & the hiring manager the same day & was also then offered the job that day. Afterwards, started the fellowship 6 months later as I was a new grad.
Interview Questions: What most excites you about this positon?

title: Hospice Case Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Mercy (Saint Louis, MO) in Jan 2017
Interview Descriptions: Application process includes a self-assessment value/work ethic/leadership in Likert scale format. Recruiter reviewed mission statement and emphasized that they were looking for people who are willing to commit to serving the community.  Hiring Manager again emphasized mission and service.  She was accessible, and they arranged for a day shadowing a senior nurse so that I would have an idea of what I was getting into.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Patient Access Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at Mercy (Oklahoma City, OK) in Jan 2017
Interview Descriptions: Got an interview because my brother's girlfriend works there and she pushed my resume. I was called immediately and went in for an interview within a couple of days. The interview lasted about 30 minutes and was very laid back. I would have been hired had a hiring freeze not taken place a few days later.
Interview Questions: Why Mercy?

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Mercy (Saint Louis, MO) in Jan 2017
Interview Descriptions: Build an excellent resume! Apply online. Wait for a response from human resources either call or email. Go to initial interview.  Go to human resources interview. Go through a company drug screen and physical. Start your new career!
Interview Questions: How have you handled a difficult confrontation with a coworker?

title: Radiologic Technologist Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Mercy (Springfield, MO)
Interview Descriptions: Short and easy. It was an interdepartment transfer. I have interviewed for several other departments within Mercy. Before I got my foot in the door, the interview process was very long. It took several months and applications to get a call back. They ask questions regarding Mercy Values as well as general questions regarding experience.
Interview Questions: Describe a time when you were under pressure and how you worked through it.

title: Recruiter Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Mercy (Saint Louis, MO) in Dec 2016
Interview Descriptions: I applied online. I then received a phone call and email to set up a time to interview in person. The interviewers we 15 minutes late and the interview lasted 30 minutes with two people.
Interview Questions: Where do you see yourself in 5 years.

title: Project Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Mercy (Saint Louis, MO) in Dec 2016
Interview Descriptions: The people were very kind but very disorganized. I felt as if I had to lead the interview just to avoid awkward silences. My interviewers had difficulty describing what tasks the role requires and seemed to lack a fundamental understanding of that I would be doing. They were so nice but just didn't seem very prepared.
Interview Questions: Have you been on projects that failed to meet deadlines? Describe the circumstances and what you could've done differently.

title: RN Case Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Mercy (Saint Louis, MO) in Dec 2016
Interview Descriptions: Standard Interview, very stale and quick. T.he panel managers acted quick and swift with the questions, they did not write the review of my interview until it was over, I wish they gave me more feedback.
Interview Questions: Why do I want to work for Mercy

title: New Grad RN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 days. I interviewed at Mercy (Oklahoma City, OK) in Nov 2016
Interview Descriptions: I actually applied online for a med/surg position, the next day the HR rep called and said I applied for the new grad program. Because I passed the NCLEX recently (although I had not gone through a new grad program at my previous job) I went on the interview. There were six department heads in the interview. The day after I received a call with a job offer. The whole process didn't take a week. I had applied for a day position and was offered a night shift, it didn't seem like HR paid much attention.
Interview Questions: I was asked to take the interview panel through the process of introducing myself to a patient, where I saw myself in five years, what was my strength and weakness is, and a few other questions

title: Business Administrator Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at Mercy (Rogers, AR) in Nov 2016
Interview Descriptions: Interviewed with 2 department hiring managers.  Interview was relaxed and very comfortable with mostly typical questions and dialogue.  Much of the conversation dealt with Mercy's mission and the type of passionate individuals they look for to add to the team to best accomplish the overall mission.
Interview Questions: How do you think your experience directly relates to the position you are applying for?

title: New Grad RN - Trauma Surg Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Mercy (Boston, MA) in Oct 2016
Interview Descriptions: Great Review. I had a phone interview with the nurse manager as I am out of state. She was very friendly, the process was more of a conversation than interrogation which is important to me.
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself and your work experience

title: Human Resources Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at Mercy
Interview Descriptions: The first interview was 45 min by phone. It consisted of normal basic interview questions. The recruiter was great, she stated I had higher qualifications and that this was entry level and asked if still interested. I said yes. She said the next step was a phone interview by a third party. This was a "personality" type text. It was really strange and was advised I could only ask them to repeat questions, that they could not clarify context of question, this call took almost 90 minutes and  consisted of questions like "do you smile?" I passed that then was asked to interview at Mercy one of their HR Managers.  This interview was comfortable with some behavioral questions, I felt I answered well. I received a call about a week and a half later that they had gone with an existing Mercy employee. I did not get the job.
Interview Questions: What role do you take in a group setting?

title: Marketing Planning Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 weeks. I interviewed at Mercy (Oklahoma City, OK)
Interview Descriptions:
The first stage was a phone interview with HR.  This was followed by an in-person interview with the hiring manager.  The third interview was a 4-person panel.  I didn't make it to the next round, but I was told that it would be a personality assessment test.  After successfully completing that, an offer would be made.
Every person I met was friendly, hospitable, kind and professional.  I would have enjoyed working with all of them!
Interview Questions: We are a faith-based organization.  There is a public prayer each morning over the intercom system and prayer before each meeting.  How do you feel about that?

title: Manager, Corporate Office Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Mercy
Interview Descriptions:
It was odd, but nice at the same time, that the recruiter interview was in person. It was clear that Mercy was intent on finding the right cultural fit. However, the after additional interviews, I discovered I was not selected for the position by logging in to my account. Never received an email, and I had even heard back from the hiring department in response to my follow up that they were still performing initial interviews. The follow up was after my profile had been updated to indicate I was not selected, but before I chose to check. 

I would still consider applying for other jobs at the company because the interviews themselves provided me enough to know that culturally, it's primarily an organization filled with great people.
Interview Questions: are you comfortable beginning all meetings in prayer?

title: Laundry Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Mercy (Springfield, MO) in Aug 2016
Interview Descriptions: You will get a phone call to make an appointment. Make sure you are a little early for your interview. After the interview you will get a tour of the plant. Ask as many questions as you need to. If you are offered the job and accept, you will get a call back to set up a time to go to Human Resource to do paperwork, Co-worker Health for a drug test, get up to date on your vaccines, and a physical test and a date and time for orientation.
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself.

title: Patient Access Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Mercy in Aug 2016
Interview Descriptions: Very friendly! I went in at sat in the waiting room and immediately saw how family oriented this company was! Everyone was friendly and I could see that customer service was there main goal!
Interview Questions: What are your strengths!?

title: Operations Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Mercy (Fort Smith, AR) in Jun 2016
Interview Descriptions: They called me and set an interview. I went through two interviews. I had a first interview with a HR manager. He asked me very basic questions such as my personality and work experience, and it took about 20 minutes. Then, I had a second interview with a hiring manager on the same day. This time we talked about some behavioral questions.
Interview Questions: What do you know about Mercy and this position?

title: Clinical Midwife: OB/GYN Faculty Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Mercy (Glen Carbon, IL) in May 2016
Interview Descriptions: What my goals, passions regarding safe midwifery birth.  What would my greatest challenges if I got this job.  I said learning their practice protocols.  I already know how to be a midwife.
Interview Questions: How do you feel about foreign clients.  I am comfortable with them; the woman/family is here for a safe rewarding birth and I want to provide that family experience for them when possible.

title: Chaplain Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Mercy (Springfield, MO) in May 2016
Interview Descriptions: The interview began with an initial phone interview.  An Additional two phone interviews and one web interview followed.  The director along with other interviews offered thoughtful questions and were easy to speak with about the position.
Interview Questions: Tell us a time when you handled conflict

title: Contracts Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Mercy (Saint Louis, MO) in Mar 2016
Interview Descriptions: there were 3 interviews total. The first was a phone interview. Second was a case interview. The third was a half day interview with several employees. Overall, the process took about 1.5 months. After the third interview I received an offer within a week.
Interview Questions: Describe a time when you displayed leadership

title: Account Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Mercy
Interview Descriptions: There is only one interview and it is directly with the hiring managers/supervisors. There are usually at least two people conducting the interview and they ask all Behavioral based questions. They are normally face-to-face, but I have seen them do phone interviews. They will often send the candidate the job description and will have the candidate start by seeing if they have any questions. If you just keep every answer patient/customer related and positive it is overall an easy interview, but I would recommend you have 5-10 scenerios because it seemed like they just kept asking the same questions and I was afraid that I might have doubled up on some answers.
Interview Questions:
Describe a time in which you went above and beyond for a customer?
Why hire you?
Communicated something difficult?
Received negative feedback and how did you handle it?

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at Mercy (Springfield, MO) in Mar 2016
Interview Descriptions: Applied online and was called for interview with the department head within a week of my application.  I was given 3 options for the interview time.  A large part of the interview was listening to the description and history of the department.  I was then asked to talk about myself and why I was leaving my current employer.
Interview Questions: To explain a situation where I was confronted with conflict and how I handled that.

title: Service Center Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied through a staffing agency. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Mercy (Saint Louis, MO) in Mar 2016
Interview Descriptions: Easiest, and Most welcoming Interview process i have ever experienced!  After the Tech talk, we spent almost 30 minutes getting to know one another.  Positively the most warm welcome to a Company Ever. I would recommend you research the company and position before the Interview to prepare yourself. Be Very Open minded, and Accepting of their Values.
Interview Questions: Basic Troubleshooting Questions, then Advanced Troubleshooting Questions about Various Business Applications.  Then we got Personal.

title: Respiratory Therapist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Mercy (Saint Louis, MO) in Mar 2016
Interview Descriptions: Several layers to the process. Started with the website submitting a resume. Then went on to the recruiter, who then moved me on to the Respiratory Director. I also interviewed with the Respiratory Services Executive Director.
Interview Questions: It has been too long, maybe how would I fit in to their department.

title: Recruiter Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Mercy (Saint Louis, MO) in Feb 2016
Interview Descriptions: Very poor interview experience. Had one initial phone screen from the recruiter, a phone screen with the hiring manager (physician recruitment manager), onsite interview with associate recruiter and hiring manager, 2 hour phone assessment, panel interview with the team, met with COO. I was mislead and basically told I had the job, to the extent we were discussing my office and the manager explained "you cant keep my pictures" as I would be moving in there. She also explained she "hoped I had enough to do"  etc which was very misleading. After providing references, I did not hear back. I reached out and received a cold email from the hiring manager that they would reach out by the end of the month. Finally received a rejection letter. I reached out to the recruiter to ask feedback and he explained "wanted to give courtesy" by reaching out. Very unprofessional especially when dealing with candidates that are recruiters. as well. Poor poor impression on Mercy Recruiting and will update others as well.
Interview Questions: Tell me about a difficult candidate.

title: Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Mercy (Chesterfield, MO) in Feb 2016
Interview Descriptions: recruiters will string you along for weeks without providing actionable answers to your questions pointing to hiring managers. Now I understand why they have several openings in my specialized field and it is because they cannot make a decision OR they are not being honest and either way is a RED FLAG. Remember - you as an applicant will never be treated better by an organization than when you are being recruited by an organization. If you have concerns during this phase and continue, you asked for what you receive.
Interview Questions: Still waiting

title: Staff RN Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 5 weeks. I interviewed at Mercy (Oklahoma City, OK) in Jan 2016
Interview Descriptions: Mercy Oklahoma City interview process is very slow. I don't understand stand manager are slow or Human Resource is slow.there is no define process candidate know about it.  Basically Hr sucks.

title: Nurse Practitioner Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Mercy (Springfield, MO)
Interview Descriptions: Very average questions but with a big ? afterwards. It was awkward with long moments of silence and I wasn't sure if I should start asking questions or if they were thinking of questions to ask me. I was very unsure of myself and whether I got the job or not.
Interview Questions: What is one thing you look for in a job? What's most important?

title: Lpn Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Mercy (Rogers, AR) in Dec 2015
Interview Descriptions: I had to wait a long time after submitting my resume for numerous positions before I received a call. Once the office manager called, I was in for an interview that week. She called me back for a second interview to meet the doctors very quickly  (within a few days). After that interview, she set up a third interview with human resources. And finally, after that interview went well, I received my offer. I  would say the whole process took about 3 weeks.
Interview Questions: Basic interview questions,  competency questions from the doctors, reliability questions from HR.

title: Nuclear Medicine Technologist Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Mercy (Springfield, MO) in Dec 2015
Interview Descriptions: Received phone interview with hiring manager. Spoke about previous experience and what the dept was currently looking for. I had stayed in touch with this manager for about 5 years so hiring process with very easy
Interview Questions: What certifications do you have?

title: Pharmacy Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Mercy (Saint Louis, MO) in Dec 2015
Interview Descriptions: I had to have a phone interview then i sat down with my pharmacy manager after that i did another phone interviews I  had to agree to be ok with prayer in the workplace. Then was offered the job
Interview Questions: Tell me about a time

title: Unit Secretary Interview
Application Type: The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Mercy (Edmond, OK) in Dec 2015
Interview Descriptions: I applied online and I got a call in about a week . I set it up for about three weeks later . I met with the main lady was about a 10 min meeting . She said I would need a peer interview with the nurses . I went in the following Monday it they asked me 4 questions then said okay we are done goodbye and showed me out . I didn't get ill call you once we know or anything .
Interview Questions: Tell me what you do at your job ?

title: Medical Records Clerk Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Mercy (Springfield, MO)
Interview Descriptions: Panel interview involved HRM and two members from the department.  Usual interview questions with the opportunity to ask any questions I had about the job I was applying for.  All panel members were friendly and made me feel very comfortable during the interview process.
Interview Questions: What type of filing system was used in my current job?

title: Supervisor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Mercy (Oklahoma City, OK)
Interview Descriptions: Slow, had trouble finding the application. Had to call the manager of the department several times so that he could get in touch with them and figure out what happened to the application, once they did find it they still did not contact the manager, the manager had to call them because they didn't have time.
Interview Questions: How do you feel about prayer at work

title: Patient Access Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Mercy (Saint Louis, MO) in Sept 2015
Interview Descriptions: I was referred by a family friend and got an interview that next week after the referral. Met with two supervisors at once. basic questions for a basic job. Was told by one of the supervisors a week later that I would be getting a call from HR soon with an offer. The next day I received a generic email from the same supervisor that I did not get the job. After inquiring (I turned down another job offer because I was told I was going to receive one here) I then received an offer for a position with the same title but in a different department. Since I needed the job I accepted and the rest, as they say, is history.
Interview Questions: Are you comfortable talking on the phone all day?

title: Intern - Hourly Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Mercy
Interview Descriptions:
I applied online. After few weeks I received the call from HR manager for first round of telephonic screening interview.   

Questions asked: Tell me about myself? Regular HR questions
Interview Questions: Tell me about myself? Regular HR questions

title: Datenanalyst Und IT-Verantwortlicher Für MS Navision Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at Mercy (Saint Louis, MO) in Aug 2015
