Interview Questions: Why do you want to work for our company?

title: Supply Chain Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Mercy (Saint Louis, MO) in Aug 2015
Interview Descriptions: Extremely long 3 interviews, long and very uncomfortable they asked weird questions and I wasn't comfortable at all seriously stressed during entire interview didn't think I would receive the position whatsoever
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Mercy (Saint Louis, MO) in Jul 2015
Interview Descriptions: I submitted my application and resume online. I was contacted by the nurse recruiter from HR. She asked a few brief questions about my experience and then set an appointment to meet with management team. I was Interviewed by 4 people in the department followed by a tour of the department. I was asked to come back for a second interview and to shadow in the department on a separate day.
Interview Questions: How do you had conflict with another coworker?

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at Mercy (Fayetteville, AR)
Interview Descriptions: Was really wierd; no nursing questions, very little details about the job. Was called back that day and told I could have the job! Salary had not even been mentioned. I said I would think about it and get back to her. I ended up taking it, I knew some about the job prior to applying.
Interview Questions: There were so few questions asked of me that I really cannot remember any right now.

title: Customer Care Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Mercy (Sacramento, CA)
Interview Descriptions: Applied online, received a phone interview and was invited for a face-to-face.   I was informed to be prepared for a two hour interview.  In fact, it was only 40 minutes.  I was walked around to different areas.
Interview Questions: I was shown a report with very rudimentary data.   I was shocked at how poor their metrics were.  When asked what I thought about it, I had difficulty trying to find anything positive to say.

title: Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Mercy (Saint Louis, MO) in Jun 2015
Interview Descriptions: Very long, several-part questions.  Gave details of job description .  Hours and days expected to work.  How transfer from department works.  If travel required and how to get reimbursed.  Also went through benefits offered.  Allowed time for questions and didn't make me feel rushed.  Offered phone number to call if any additional questions.
Interview Questions: Would i be wiiling to respect the prayer offering at start of meetings.

title: Radiology Technologist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at Mercy (Washington, MO) in Jun 2015
Interview Descriptions: They call you to come in for an in person interview.  They interview you and give you a tour of the department.  You take a drug test and they run a background check.  If you pass both those you will get an offer.
Interview Questions: Have you ever been arrested for a felony?

title: Security Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 weeks. I interviewed at Mercy (Oklahoma City, OK) in Jun 2015
Interview Descriptions: A one-on-one with the Executive Director, followed by a panel interview that included HR and Ethics personnel.  From application submission to final interview, the selection process took about 5 weeks.  Interviews were approximately one hour in length and involved multiple scripted questions that were asked of all candidates.  Approximately 1 week after the final interview a decision was made and announced.
Interview Questions: What leadership qualities to do you feel you bring to this position that would make you successful?

title: Administration Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Mercy
Interview Descriptions: Applied online.  Admin assistant for department called to set up interview for a Friday.  Recieved a call for a second interview the following Monday.  Interviewed with VP on Friday and was offered the job the next Monday.  Initial application was submitted about a month before I heard anything, but once the ball was rolling things moved quickly.
Interview Questions: Where do you see yourself in 5 years?

title: Advanced Nurse Tech Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Mercy (Oklahoma City, OK) in May 2015
Interview Descriptions: I was already a nurse extern, so I was transferring roles. For my nurse extern interview, I was called to set up an interview date which they easily worked around my school schedule. After setting the date, I arrived at my interview and went down to the conference center to check in and wait for the people who would be interviewing me. I was scheduled for two interviews. For one of the interviews, I was met down in the conference center and the interview was carried out in one of the rooms. For the second interview I met my interviewer up in her office. The interview was a 1:1 interview carried out by the leaders of the various floors I had applied to.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work at Mercy?

title: Staff RN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Mercy in Apr 2015
Interview Descriptions: Pretty straight forward, nothing too daunting.  Do a basic job interview prep of top 30 interview questions and you'll be fine.  Show up on time, dress professionally.  They asked a lot of questions but seemed to be your average interview process.  Manager was very friendly.
Interview Questions: Why are you leaving previous employer?

title: Intern - Hourly Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Mercy in Apr 2015
Interview Descriptions: Consisted of a phone screening for "cultural fit" and other basic behavioral questions. Two people on the call, very personable. Made the process feel much less robotic than other phone interviews in the past. Next was an in-person interview which was again, very personable. Casual conversation to discuss experience, expectation, etc. This was an interview for an intern position, so it was admittedly less intensive than one would be for a full-time position.
Interview Questions: A time you have encountered a struggle with diversity. (very diverse organization, but with codified Christian values)

title: Nursing Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Mercy (Oklahoma City, OK) in Apr 2015
Interview Descriptions: They asked basic questions to get to know you and how you may function as well as what your interests were. The only thing I didn't appreciate was once they knew the distance of where I lived, it seemed like everything we had talked about and all of my qualifications just flew out the door. It's sad to think that my address is what affected my chances of landing the job. If the commute was a problem for me, I obviously wouldn't have applied for the position to start with. You would think it would make a difference when I said that I am willing to relocate, apparently I was sorely mistaken. Also, I wish any type of feedback would be given to allow you the chance to improve or at least an explanation to why you were rejected. Oh well, the hunt continues.
Interview Questions: What are your strengths and weaknesses?

title: Statistician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Mercy
Interview Descriptions: I submited the application online. It took about 3 weeks to process. Phone interview with HR asking questions mostly about items listing on my resume. The interviewer is nice and very on time. The process stopped there due to some family issue and position filled two weeks after. I would definitely consider the organization if there is another chance in the future.
Interview Questions: What did you do for your previous internship?

title: Paramedic Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Mercy (Springfield, MO) in Feb 2015
Interview Descriptions: First had a phone interview to make sure I met basic qualifications. Then had a face-to-face interview with Regional Manager and Field Supervisor. Very simple process. There was no protocol quiz to take due to how things work in this part of the state. You will learn all about Mercy EMS protocol in orientation. Did ask a few questions about certifications and licenses held. One or two questions about past experience.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work for Mercy EMS?

title: Lab Support Tech II Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Mercy (Saint Louis, MO) in Feb 2015
Interview Descriptions: I feel that the interview is not only made by a good interviewee, but also a good interviewer. I felt that in the interview I did not received well enough questions that truly displayed my interviewing capabilities. I feel that the quality of questions one receives in an interview is a big part of success in an interview.
Interview Questions: What is one of your weaknesses and how would you improve it?

title: Project Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Mercy (Springfield, IL) in Feb 2015
Interview Descriptions: A very laid back interview because my Aunt works for the company and is very high up in the company and simply got me the internship. They showed me around the building and gave me an idea of what my job position will require. After they did all of this they made me a snack and I had a one on one conversation with the President of the company. This was a great feeling as i finally walked throught the the the the the the the the the the the the the the the the the the the the then then then thn then then then then then then then then
Interview Questions: What do you want to get out of this internship?

title: Instructional Designer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 weeks. I interviewed at Mercy
Interview Descriptions: I interviewed from another state. The total interview process took about 3 weeks and consisted of approximately four separate interviews. It was intense but effective, and the process allowed me to determine if I was the right fit and if Mercy was the right fit for me. The process started with the 20 minute recruiter interview, then the 60 minute hiring manager interview, followed by a personality style interview which was scheduled for 2 hours. Mine took about 90 minutes and was very thorough. Finally, there was a Skype interview. It took an additional 3 weeks before an offer was made, but this was due to the process spanning 2 holidays.
Interview Questions: Do you strive to make your manager look good?

title: Laboratory Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at Mercy (Saint Louis, MO) in Jan 2015
Interview Descriptions: I Applied online,two days laters  recieved a call to set up a good interview date and time, next day had a phone interview then they called back a gave me a offer,i accepted the position,then started a few weeks later and it has been wonderfuo experience ever since.
Interview Questions: Basic questions

title: Tech Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 4 days. I interviewed at Mercy (Kansas City, KS) in Jan 2015
Interview Descriptions: it was very very very long process time consuming and there were a lot of people, i want to be a tech i don't know really  people were there and had no clue what was going on, why is this required just to look at a review now
Interview Questions: My name

title: RN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 months. I interviewed at Mercy (Saint Louis, MO) in Dec 2014
Interview Descriptions: It was long and lengthy. A lot had to with me and moving back to area. I had 3 interviews over the phone before I returned for an interview in December and it was some what a difficult interview for me.        I'm not a custom to group interviews.  My interviews typically are short and sweet, the really just want to know my skills. I tried to prepare for it. I was hoping my excellent skills and a good personality would have made the difference. What was the biggest disappointed they said they would inform me 2 weeks after the stated. I did understand it was the holidays.  Lucky I was able to come up with a back up plan. I was seeking full time permanent work and leaving the travel companies.
Interview Questions: What would you do in this situation. . ?

title: Chemical Dependency Counselor Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Mercy
Interview Descriptions: There was a panel of 4 employees including the person who was being replaced due to retirement. Formal interview questions were used as well as a few impromptu scenarios.
Interview Questions: How would I handle a difficult client?

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Mercy in Nov 2014
Interview Descriptions: It was a group interview that consisted of 3 nurses and 1 other individual. They had 7 questions which were pretty simple and we flew through them pretty quickly. It was over the phone so I was not sitting down with anyone. Like usual, they told me they'd pass my info along and would contact me. Seeing how Im a current employee and was just looking to transfer I thought that they'd be transparent with me. However they never call or emailed me. I even reached out a couple times and they didnt have the respect enough to return my call.
Interview Questions: What is administrative assistant mean to you?

title: STaff Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Mercy (Saint Louis, MO) in Nov 2014
Interview Descriptions: The interview was a panel interview with 6 interviewers. The people were all nurses from the floor that I was being interviewed for.  The questions were typical PBI type questions. The questions were situational and dealt with your past experiences and the character and integrity you used to work through them or solve them.
Interview Questions: Tell us about a time when you dealt with a difficult patient. How did you deal with the situation and what was the outcome?

title: Staff RN Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at Mercy (Springfield, MO) in Nov 2014
Interview Descriptions: Possibly the most damning portion of the interview process is the "Mercy Fit" test. It is a long test that determines whether or not you fit in with the Mercy spirit through ethics-based lines of questioning. If an applicant fails this test, they can never retake it and can never be employed at Mercy. Ever. You also must submit a traditional application and interview once with a Mercy representative and again with your floor manager.
Interview Questions: Describe a time that you had to stand up for what you believed in to your superiors.

title: Admitting Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. I interviewed at Mercy (Saint Louis, MO) in Sept 2014
Interview Descriptions: They didn't ask many questions. More concerned if I already knew how to use Epic, the electronic health system. They were impressed with my resume and tried to sell the position to me. Two supervisors will interview you at once. My advice is to find someone who already works for Mercy because they take more referrals rather than external applicants.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Medical Office Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at Mercy
Interview Descriptions: Attended a hiring fair, interview questions were pretty straight forward. Was interviewed on the spot and asked back for a second one on one interview with upper management. I appeared to  both  interviews with a small nose stud, nothing was mentioned about it and i went on to be offered the job. when i was working there for about 6 months i was approached by management and was told I had to remove it as it was against company policy.
Interview Questions: i Where do you see yourself in 5 years ?

title: Lead Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. I interviewed at Mercy in Jul 2014
Interview Descriptions: Very professional and ask about your experiences. did not go more into technical questions. very friendly and made comfortable. Very professional and ask about your experiences. did not go more into technical questions. very friendly and made comfortable.
Interview Questions: Past job experiences

title: Director, Health Information Management Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Mercy (Mountain View, MO)
Interview Descriptions: This process involved a "Talent" Telephone Interview and it was exceptional.  They asked many questions; there were areas pertinent to me as a person, specific to being a manager/director, also questions relative to my past career history, as well as, my strengths and weaknesses.  I found this process to be extremely enlightening.  I felt that it gave me the opportunity to see if this was an organization I wanted to work with as well as if I would be a "right fit" for them.
Interview Questions: What has been my biggest disappointment in my career.

title: Medical Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Mercy (Springfield, MO) in Jun 2014
Interview Descriptions: Applied and was called for an interview 2 weeks later.the interview consisted of myself and 2 managers. after a week I was called and offered the position. There was a lot of phone tag between myself and the recruiter in HR.
Interview Questions: How would you handle a situation where conflict arises between yourself and a coworker?

title: Practice Manager III Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Mercy (Saint Louis, MO) in Jun 2014
Interview Descriptions: Several steps to ensure Mercy fit. Very professional. Willing to work around my schedule. In person meeting with supervisor and team then a phone interview with human resources. Each in person interview took an hour or more. The phone interview was 20 minutes or so. Overall typical and expected. No curveballs.
Interview Questions: Tell me about a difficult situation you have been in and how you handled it.

title: Coordinator of Paramedic Outreach Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Mercy
Interview Descriptions: Applied within 24 hours of the position being posted. Got an email back a couple of days later saying they had filled the position. Felt that the application process was a waste of time.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Foundation Staff Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Mercy
Interview Descriptions: I had two face to face interviews with upper management.
Interview Questions: Interview was fairly common with all the usual questions in fundraising regarding experience for the position, how you handle working with people, largest gift received, how you handle change on a daily basis, etc.

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Mercy (Ardmore, OK)
Interview Descriptions: Interviewed by one manager
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Mercy in Mar 2014
Interview Descriptions: Filled out internal transfer after looking at career at Mercy online for the facility. Received notification of my application being submitted via my personal email address. Checked back with the website to see if I was being considered.  Approximately one month later had an interview. Then a phone call from the manager that stated that I did not receive the position.
Interview Questions: What can you do for this company? Why do you think you are qualified for this position?  I thought this was odd already being an employee.

title: Interventional Radiology Technologist Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Mercy (Oklahoma City, OK) in Jan 2014
Interview Descriptions: talked briefly on the phone, received call next day that I had the job.  that should have been a red flag, while I was there, I saw numerous people come and go
Interview Questions: do you have any neuro experience

title: Administration Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at Mercy in Jan 2014
Interview Descriptions: Interviewed and received a job offer from my manager the same day, but then didn't hear from HR with an official offer for another three months.  (I shared I wasn't able to start until five months after the interview date due to being in school.)
Interview Questions: How does the Ministry of Mercy apply to you?

title: Staff RN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at Mercy (Springfield, MO) in Jan 2014
Interview Descriptions: Online application was first step.  Then human resources forwarded app to floor manager then call made and interview set up.  Lots of what if questions and opportunity to ask questions.  Relaxed with manager.  Then wait a day for call back from human resources.
Interview Questions: What would you do if you were feeling stressed out?

title: Pharmacy Technician I Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Mercy
Interview Descriptions: Applied through website, was called 2-3 weeks later asking to come in for an interview that day. Talked with pharmacy director for about 45 minutes just asking why I was interested in the job, what skills I brought, how much I was willing to work, etc. Got a call about a week later asking me to set up a peer interview and got a call about a week after that offering me the job and telling me what my pay would be.
Interview Questions: Warned me this would be a different question, and then asked me what my closet looked like (wanted to see how organized I was)

title: Security Officer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Mercy (Joplin, MO) in Dec 2013
Interview Descriptions: there wasn't much to the hiring process. got a call for an interview. went to the interview. the interview wasn't really much of an interview. mostly just the manager telling me what the job entails. never really asking me questions to see if i was really a fit for the position. as long as you have previous customer service experience you're golden.
Interview Questions: do you have any questions for us?

title: Applications Developer Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 4 months. I interviewed at Mercy (Chesterfield, MO) in Oct 2013
Interview Descriptions: HR interview, first round phone technical screen, second round in person technical screen, 3rd round Mangers round.  HR on boarding interview.  Offer negotiation.
Interview Questions: unexpected - Are you eligible to work in US? my answer was Yes.  No follow up questions were asked and i haven't followed it up with my H1B sponsorship.  The rookie recruiter was rude and said the company is not sponsoring H1Bs anymore.

title: Applications Developer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Mercy (Chesterfield, MO)
Interview Descriptions: Three portions of interview: phone interview (behavioral), technical interview, and face-to-face (behavioral) interview
Interview Questions: Technical interview: to design schema of solution for specific situation

title: Patient Care Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Mercy (Springfield, MO) in Oct 2013
Interview Descriptions: The online application was basic. There is a Mercy Fit Test after submitting the application that asks situational questions and personality questions ("On a scale of 1 to 10, how caring are you.") that takes approx. 25 minutes to complete. The manager will call to set up the interview. The interview consisted of some basic questions and some situational questions. It lasted about 20-30 minutes and was only with the manager of the floor that I applied to. No skills testing beforehand. Pretty harmless.
Interview Questions: What are your strengths and weaknesses?

title: Pharmacy Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Mercy (Saint Louis, MO) in Oct 2013
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was the easiest i've ever been to. At first you start off at their office location and interview with HR. Then I interviewed with the department of pharmacy director and supervisor.  I was in and out within 10 minutes. They asked the basic interview questions "why do you want this position?" , "what do you want from us as an employer?" "what would you bring to the table?".  I felt like they just wanted to see who i was and if i was reliable. Nothing complicated at all.
Interview Questions: What do you need to remain happy here?

title: Medical Technologist Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Mercy (Springfield, MO) in Oct 2013
Interview Descriptions: Interview was very easy going! I had one interview at HR and one with my future supervisor at the laboratory. At HR they asked me general questions, such as how do I handle stress? Why do I think I'm a good fit for Mercy? How would I handle situations with my coworkers? I'm a team player? Can I work under stress?
Interview Questions: How do you handle stress?

title: Clinic Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Mercy
Interview Descriptions: Initially screened by phone by human resources.  Received a call from the manager who set up a face to face interview.  Came back for a second interview and was given a tentative offer the next day.  Had to go in for a physical, drug test before the final offer was given.
Interview Questions: What are your greatest strengths and weakness questions.

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at Mercy (Ardmore, OK) in May 2013
Interview Descriptions: Very personable with management.   Nothing out of the ordinary.  They are glad to have you.  They should be b/c everybody ends up leaving.  The pay used to be a factor but is not now for beginning RN's.  The interview process is the same as other hospitals in that you get screened, drug test, background check, and group interview.  It was pleasant.
Interview Questions: What is your nursing background?

title: Director Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Mercy
Interview Descriptions: Initial interview was via the phone, contacted quickly via phone and then flew out to meet the Senior Management team. All in all process took 2-3 weeks.
Interview Questions: Do you feel comfortable praying and where is your stand on religion?

title: Medical Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at Mercy in Feb 2013
Interview Descriptions:
Several interviews over several days 
Must pass drug test and take a talent survey , must travel to HR for badge and filing of paperwork. Must complete 2 weeks of EHR training.
Interview Questions: What is your best attribute

title: RN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Mercy (Saint Louis, MI) in Sept 2012
Interview Descriptions: Took about 2 months to get hired on after my first contact with HR.  had three interviews, one with Hr, one with manager of dept, and one with other staff/nurses of dept and then I had to shadow a nurse for about 4 hours.  Nothing too special or too difficult during HR interview
Interview Questions: Typical hr interview, dept interviews were more of them telling me how dept ran.   They didn't ask questions, so I had to use my list of questions, which they basically answered while telling me about the function of the dept

title: Business Office Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Mercy (Springfield, MO) in Aug 2012
Interview Descriptions: Two business office managers interviewed me for about 20 minutes. They asked me several scearios and how I dealt with them, asked me if I was comfortable working for a Catholic organization, and described some potentially difficult parts of the position.
Interview Questions: Describe a time you failed, how did you deal with it?

title: Patient Care Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at Mercy (Saint Louis, MO) in Aug 2012
Interview Descriptions: HR called me within couple of days, nice and brief phone interview, then scheduled face-to-face interview which was nice and smooth. Did not have to wait too long, HR lady was very friendly and seemed to care. Standart  questions about personality, values etc.
Interview Questions: What are your strong positive  personal characteristic?

title: Patient Account Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 6 weeks. I interviewed at Mercy (Saint Louis, MO) in Jul 2012
Interview Descriptions: I went through several interviews.  Initial interview was for a different department and it ended up not being available.  However, the manager thought that I was such a good fit for Mercy he passed my resume along to a different department to help get my foot in the door.  Turns out I did get the job which was greatly appreciated.
Interview Questions: Tell me about a time when you had to make a hard decision. Explain what happened

title: IT Architect Lead Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Mercy (Saint Louis, MO) in May 2012
Interview Descriptions: The Solutions Engineering team is seeking a Thin Client End Point (Citrix, HP) Engineer with prior experience with Citrix and thin client products to provide Virtual Desktop Infrastructure (VDI) and Thin Client Services (TCS) working with the P-VDI Team.  Additional skill sets required to include, HP, Dell, or other thin client management tools experience.  Duties and responsibilities includ
Interview Questions: vdi, sccm, windows, app-v

title: Radiologic Technologist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Mercy (Saint Louis, MO) in Mar 2012
Interview Descriptions: My interview process was a very traditional, very brief, one on one session.  My interview consisted of the standard interview questions: List your strengths, List your weaknesses, what are your short term goals, long term goals.  The interview process itself lasted maybe fifteen minutes.  My resume was reviewed and questions were asked about it.
Interview Questions: Name a positive experience you experienced working in the medical field?

title: Medical Technologist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Mercy (Ardmore, OK) in Dec 2011
Interview Descriptions: Mercy is very to the point. The HR department and management was extremely compassionate and understanding and willing to do what they could to get me hired on. I believe that they had wanted to hire me before bringing me into the interview, and I just talked to HR, management and had a quick tour and meet and greet with my coworkers. It was all complete in a matter of an hour and a half. I was very relieved at how nice and enthusiastic everyone was and it eased my nerves especially with moving from another state. Once I got to the interview, I knew this was a good move. I now have 2 appointments to make before I begin work: to get put into the system and drug test (which thankfully they do in house which is not normally how I remember hospitals doing) and then my orientation.
Interview Questions: How are you?

title: Patient Care Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Mercy (Fort Smith, AR) in Aug 2011
Interview Descriptions:
interviews total.  I got my second interview schedule right after the first one with HR.
Hiring manager was nice. She asked questions about the jobs and personality. I got a phone call a week after that I got a job offer. I like the work environment and people that I worked with. I quited  after 3 years because of school.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work in the ER?

title: Account Coordinator I Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at Mercy (Saint Louis, MO) in Jul 2011
Interview Descriptions: Initial HR interview consisted of behavioral questions. After passing that you move to the face-to-face interview with the Manager, Supervisor and Business Analyst. They go over a series of behavioral questions. All of which are easy to answer as long as you are able to think on the spot. I was offered the position shortly after I returned from a vacation.
Interview Questions: Name a time when you showed care for a patient or co-worker under stressful circumstances.

title: Instrument Tech Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Mercy (Oklahoma City, OK) in Jul 2011
Interview Descriptions: Put in the transfer to go to another dept. They replay replied back within 2-days.. Got my first interview only took 30mins.. Got another interview a day later.. Only took one hour.. Then got a peer interview the next day.. Where I got interview by the co-worker. They did an ending meeting to offer me the job.
Interview Questions: Why you think you should get the job?

title: CNA, Patient Care Tech Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Mercy (Festus, MO) in Jun 2011
Interview Descriptions: It was simple. It took only a few weeks to get hired. They will send you to several different departments to get rated and reviewed. Then they will offer you a salary. Put everything related to healthcare in your application. They will use it to determine how much you will be offered. There is little to no wiggle or negotiation room.
Interview Questions: What can you bring to our team?

title: Pct Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Mercy (Springfield, MA) in Feb 2011
Interview Descriptions: one on one with a manager asking you questions about your qualities experience with people where do you see yourself in 2 yrs with this company.Can you work holidays can you work weekends can you work overtime. Do you have any family issues that would conflict with you getting to work on time
Interview Questions: How can you  be an assess to us what qualities do you exceed in

title: Registration Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Mercy (Saint Louis, MO) in Feb 2011
Interview Descriptions: Brief and to the point.  Initial interview was over the phone, second interview in person with middle management.  I was told that I met the qualifications and he would skip the process of their normal third interview with the direct supervisor.  I was sent an offer within 48 hours and asked to submit to a drug and background test within 72 hours.
Interview Questions: How have I handled a problematic patient/customer in the past?

title: Intern Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 4 days. I interviewed at Mercy (Saint Louis, MO) in Dec 2010
Interview Descriptions: Wasn't Bad, No real question outside the expected.  Very Type A interview.  But the People are nice
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Customer Service Analyst IV Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Mercy (Saint Louis, MO) in Dec 2010
Interview Descriptions: I worked for the company for three years and was doing the job of CSA IV. When the position opened and I applied they changed it into another CSA III position. There is no career pathing at Mercy unless you can pick up another skillset. There are other jobs in MISD but everyone is going for those jobs so its pretty saturated.
Interview Questions: What is the hardest decision you've made at a workplace?

title: Sales Interview
Application Type: I applied through a staffing agency. The process took 5 weeks. I interviewed at Mercy (Chesterfield, MO) in Mar 2010
Interview Descriptions: good
Interview Questions: Why leave your company?

title: Consultant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at Mercy (Springfield, MO) in Jan 2010
Interview Descriptions:
Only one interview. It was informal and insightful. I knew I would be a good fit from the start. The questions were not difficult, or lengthy. 
Broad discussion and abstractions of the upcoming task/projects. Detailed discussions of the mission critical components and aspects.
The interview was long, but it passed quickly.
Interview Questions: Needed to explain in great detail my personal solution and critical thought process to a hypothetical issue.
